videoTitle: Behind the Scenes: Getting an Infusion for Multiple Sclerosis
videoDescription: "Receiving this diagnosis was devastating but it has truly showed me just how strong I could be. It made me all the more thankful for my amazing support system of family and friends. It’s made me step completely out of my comfort zone and share my journey in hopes of helping other people and spreading awareness. It’s put me into rooms with amazing organizations that are supporting my advocacy work. It’s opened up doors to work with the Emerging Leaders Board for the National MS Society and participate in campaigns for We Are ILL and Rush Medical Center! I used to ask 'why' a lot in the beginning. All I wanted to do was understand why this was happening to me. I am slowly realizing that MS didn’t happen to me, but for me. It’s putting me on a different path that God is clearly showing me I am supposed to be on." — Bri Pearson. #MultipleSclerosisAwarenessMonth #MS #Shorts
caption: false

videoTitle: Matthew Dixon, MD, Surgical Oncologist at RUSH
videoDescription: Matthew Dixon, MD, is a surgical oncologist with RUSH. He specializes in hepato-pancreato-biliary surgery. Witnessing patients navigate complex surgeries, recover, and return to their lives after a cancer diagnosis is a deeply fulfilling aspect of his work, allowing him to restore a sense of normalcy and humanity to their lives. Learn more and schedule an appointment at https://rsh.md/4aTWOie.

videoTitle: Young Patient Travels from Costa Rica to Chicago for Rare Disease Treatment at RUSH
videoDescription: Seven years ago, doctors in Costa Rica told Maria's mother, "There is nothing we can do." But Maria's family refused to accept defeat. Instead, they embarked on a life-changing journey to Chicago, seeking the hope and care Maria deserved at RUSH. Every month, Maria and her family travel from Costa Rica to Chicago, where she receives life-saving treatment for Niemann-Pick Type C, a rare disease. Here, they found not only expert medical care but also a nurturing community that supports Maria's treatment and travel. Today, Maria continues to defy the odds, showcasing the resilience of the human spirit and the strength of a mother's love.
caption: false

videoTitle: Recovering from Awake Brain Surgery at RUSH
videoDescription: Nick was up and walking just hours after awake brain surgery for #Glioblastoma at RUSH. Together, we're taking on the most aggressive and common form of brain cancer. Join our fight: https://rsh.md/BrainTumors

videoTitle: Awake Brain Surgery at RUSH

videoTitle: The da Vinci Xi Robot
videoDescription: Did you know that playing video games as a kid could give you an advantage in the operating room? Introducing the da Vinci XI robot - a game-changer in surgery that's part of everyday excellence at RUSH! This advanced tech features 3 sections: a vision cart, the robot itself, and a surgeon's console. With 3D imaging and tiny, wrist-like instruments, it enables precise movements and dissections that are harder to achieve with traditional methods. The result? Smaller incisions, faster recovery times, and improved surgical outcomes. #RUSH #DaVinciRobot #Surgery #Innovation #HealthcareTech #RoboticSurgery
caption: false

videoTitle: Bri's Ocrevus Journey
videoDescription: "A little over a year ago, I was staring at a computer screen in an emergency room, listening to a team of neurologists tell me that my MRI results were conclusive for multiple sclerosis (MS). Two relapses and a running list of irreparable damage later, I was officially diagnosed with relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis. Every single day has been a fight to find and process my new normal. A fight to give myself grace, a fight to be okay with not being OK, a fight to not feel alone when I have the most amazing support system anyone could ask for …" Bri is a #MSWarrior. And she's got RUSH on her side. Learn more: https://rsh.md/3yrzypC #MSAwarenessMonth #MultipleSclerosis #Ocrevus #OcrevusInfusion #InfusionTherapy

This is just one example of how Rush is stepping up to Be the Change.

videoTitle: Bariatric Surgery at Rush
videoDescription: The Rush Center for Weight Loss and Bariatric Surgery works holistically to care for their patients. Patients receive world class care before, during and after their surgery, and get regular support from teams of dietitians and psychologists to help improve their lifestyles and mental health so they can keep the weight off and stay healthy.
tags: bariatric surgery,rush university medical center,weight loss
caption: true

videoTitle: Bariatric Surgery at Rush: Katie's Story
videoDescription: With a family history of obesity and difficulties losing weight with dieting and exercise, Katie felt she was running out of options. After having bariatric surgery at Rush, and with the help of a team of Rush dietitians and weight loss therapists, Katie lost 65 pounds and feels it was "truly an investment in my future."
tags: rush university medical center,bariatric surgery,bariatrics,weight loss
caption: true

videoTitle: Bariatric Surgery at Rush: Fran's Story
videoDescription: Following multiple surgeries for her knees, hips and back, Fran started thinking about weight loss surgery. After having bariatric surgery at Rush, and with the help of a team of Rush dietitians and psychologists, Fran lost more than 200 pounds and was again able to travel and feel good while doing so.
tags: rush university medical center,bariatric surgery,bariatrics,weight loss
caption: true

videoTitle: Bariatric Surgery at Rush: Cora's Story
videoDescription: Cora's experience as a nurse at Rush made her realize that her struggles with her weight and high blood pressure meant she needed to take action to stay healthy. After having bariatric surgery at Rush, and with the help of a team of Rush surgeons, dietitians and weight loss therapists, Cora lost a significant amount of weight and continues to lose weight today.
tags: rush university medical center,bariatric surgery,bariatrics,weight loss
caption: true

videoTitle: Bariatric Surgery at Rush: Maria's Story
videoDescription: Maria was recovering from a cerebral spinal fluid leak in her brain when she realized her weight was negatively affecting her overall health. After having gastric bypass surgery at Rush, and with the help of a team of Rush dietitians and psychologists, Maria lost more than 100 pounds and is no longer "on the sidelines" of life.
tags: rush university medical center,bariatric surgery,bariatrics,weight loss
caption: true

videoDescription: Many COVID-19 patients require mechanical ventilation to get the oxygen they need and also keep the lungs open much as possible to get the oxygen into their bloodstream. videoTitle: Prone Positioning for Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS)
videoDescription: Some COVID-19 patients are experiencing acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and require mechanical ventilation. While a patient is on a ventilator, Rush staff use a technique called “prone positioning” to improve oxygenation. Rush has developed a four-phase checklist to facilitate the process of placing a patient into the prone position. The process consists of six staff members working together to correctly place a patient into position. Learn more at https://www.rush.edu/patients-visitors/covid-19-resources

videoTitle: Keith Millikan, MD, Surgeon at RUSH
videoDescription: Keith Millikan, MD, is a surgeon with RUSH. He specializes in three areas of general surgery: appendix, gall bladder, and heartburn surgery; hernia surgery; and cancer treatment, particularly esophageal, stomach, pancreatic, and liver cancer. In this video, Dr. Millikan discusses how his approach involves both traditional open surgery and minimally invasive techniques, allowing for personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's specific condition and needs, whether surgery, chemotherapy, or radiation therapy should come first.
